text: The burden of Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is jealous, and the Lord revengeth: the Lord revengeth: even the Lord of anger, the Lord will take vengeance on his adversaries, and he reserveth wrath for his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is slow to anger, but he is great in power, and will not surely clear the wicked: the Lord hath his way in the whirlwind, and in the storm, and the clouds are the dust of his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: He rebuketh the sea, and drieth it, and he drieth up all the rivers: Bashan is wasted and Carmel, and the flower of Lebanon is wasted.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mountains tremble for him, and the hills melt, and the earth is burnt at his sight, yea the world, and all that dwell therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who can stand before his wrath? or who can abide in the fierceness of his wrath? his wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord is good and as a stronghold in the day of trouble, and he knoweth them that trust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But passing over as with a flood, he will utterly destroy the place thereof, and darkness shall pursue his enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text: What do ye imagine against the Lord? he will make an utter destruction: affliction shall not rise up the second time.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he shall come as unto thorns folden one in another, and as unto drunkards in their drunken-ness: they shall be devoured as stubble fully dried.
speaker: Narrator

text: There cometh one out of thee that imagineth evil against the Lord, even a wicked counselor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the Lord, Though they be quiet, and also many, yet thus shall they be cut off when he shall pass by: though I have afflicted thee, I will afflict thee no more.
speaker: Narrator

text: For now I will break his yoke from thee, and will burst thy bonds in sunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord hath given a commandment concerning thee that no more of thy name be sown: out of the house of thy gods will I cut off the graven, and the molten image: I will make it thy grave for thee, for thou art vile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold upon the mountains the feet of him that declareth, and publisheth peace: O Judah, keep thy solemn feasts, perform thy vows: for the wicked shall no more pass through thee: he is utterly cut off.
speaker: Narrator

text: The destroyer is come before thy face: keep the munition: look to the way: make thy loins strong: increase thy strength mightily.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath turned away the glory of Jacob, as the glory of Israel: for the emptiers have emptied them out, and marred their vine branches.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shield of his mighty men is made red, the valiant men are in scarlet: the chariots shall be as in the fire and flames in the day of his preparation, and the fir trees shall tremble.
speaker: Narrator

text: The chariots shall rage in the streets: they shall run to and fro in the highways: they shall seem like lamps: they shall shoot like the lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: He shall remember his strong men: they shall stumble as they go: they shall make haste to the walls thereof, and the defense shall be prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gates of the rivers shall be opened, and the palace shall melt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Huzzab the Queen shall be led away captive, and her maids shall lead her as with the voice of doves, smiting upon their breasts.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Nineveh is of old like a pool of water: yet they shall flee away. Stand, stand, shall they cry: but none shall look back.
speaker: Narrator

text: Spoil ye the silver, spoil the gold: for there is none end of the store and glory of all the pleasant vessels.
speaker: Narrator

text: She is empty and void and waste, and the heart melteth, and the knees smite together, and sorrow is in all loins, and the faces of them all gather blackness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the dwelling of the lions, and the pasture of the lion’s whelps? where the lion and the lioness waked, and the lion’s whelp, and none made them afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: The lion did tear in pieces enough for his whelps, and worried for his lioness, and filled his holes with prey, and his dens with spoil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I come unto thee saith the Lord of hosts, and I will burn her chariots in the smoke, and the sword shall devour thy young lions, and I will cut off thy spoil from the earth, and the voice of thy messengers shall no more be heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: O bloody city, it is all full of lies and robbery: the prey departeth not.
speaker: Narrator

text: The noise of a whip, and the noise of the moving of the wheels, and the beating of the horses, and the leaping of the chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: The horseman lifteth up both the bright sword, and the glittering spear, and a multitude is slain, and the dead bodies are many: there is none end of their corpses: they stumble upon their corpses,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of the multitude of the fornications of the harlot that is beautiful, and is a mistress of witchcraft, and selleth the people through her whoredom, and the nations through her witchcrafts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I come upon thee, saith the Lord of hosts, and will discover thy skirts upon thy face, and will show the nations thy filthiness, and the kingdoms thy shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will cast filth upon thee, and make thee vile, and will set thee as a gazing stock.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee, shall flee from thee, and say, Nineveh is destroyed, who will have pity upon her? where shall I seek comforters for thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: Art thou better than No, which was full of people? that lay in the rivers, and had the waters round about it? whose ditch was the sea, and her wall was from the sea?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ethiopia and Egypt were her strength, and there was none end: Put and Lubim were her helpers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet was she carried away, and went into captivity: her young children also were dashed in pieces at the head of all the streets: and they cast lots for her noble men, and all her mighty men were bound in chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also thou shalt be drunken: thou shalt hide thyself, and shalt seek help because of the enemy.
speaker: Narrator

text: All thy strong cities shall be like fig trees with the first ripe figs: for if they be shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, thy people within thee are women: the gates of thy land shall be opened unto thine enemies, and the fire shall devour thy bars.
speaker: Narrator

text: Draw thee waters for the siege: fortify thy strongholds: go into the clay, and temper the mortar: make strong brick.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall the fire devour thee: the sword shall cut thee off: it shall eat thee up like the locusts, though thou be multiplied like the locusts, and multiplied like the grasshopper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou hast multiplied thy merchants above the stars of heaven: the locust spoileth and flieth away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy princes are as the grasshoppers, and thy captains as the great grasshoppers which remain in the hedges in the cold day: but when the sun ariseth, they flee away, and their place is not known where they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thy shepherds do sleep, O king of Assyria: thy strong men lie down: thy people is scattered upon the mountains, and no man gathereth them.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no healing of thy wound: thy plague is grievous: all that hear the brute of thee, shall clap the hands over thee: for upon whom hath not thy malice passed continually?
speaker: Narrator
